author: Staff Reporter
text:
Prof. S. Hariharan, Director of University Grants Commission-Human Resource Development Centre (HRDC), has been relieved from his post and repatriated to his parent department following a direction from the Union Home Ministry.

According to the Pondicherry University’s order, citing the letters and reminders received from the MHRD regarding Central Vigilance Commission’s cases pending,

“Dr. S. Hariharan is relieved from the duties of the director, UGC-HRDC (formerly known as Academic Staff College) with immediate effect and repatriated to the post of Professor, Department of Management Studies, School of Management of the University.

According to sources, Dr. Hariharan came under the CBI scanner for alleged irregularities in granting approval to a private engineering college while he was a member of the AICTE panel two years ago.

The CBI had sought permission from the University authorities to prosecute him in 2010 and again in 2013 during the tenure of former Vice-Chancellors.

However, permission was denied. Dr. Hariharan was also charged in the illegal detention and torture of a student from the Department of Tamil.

title: Prof. S. Hariharan relieved of UGC post
